dataset.title: Dataset: Mangrove, tidal wetland and seagrass soil carbon stocks along latitudinal gradients
dataset.abstract: Coastal and marine ecosystems have the potential to produce and sequester organic carbon at rates that exceed tropical and temperate forests. Recent recognition of the value of these ecosystems as significant carbon sinks has strengthened worldwide interest in their management, conservation, and restoration for the purpose of climate change mitigation. However, many gaps in understanding carbon sequestration in coastal ecosystems remain, creating challenges for the application coastal ecosystem carbon research at local, regional and global scales. A major limitation is the fact that most research on this topic has been conducted in relatively few temperate and tropical ecosystems, despite a tremendous amount of spatial variability in carbon stocks across gradients of climate, hydrology, geomorphology, and tide range. Additionally, a standardized protocol has not been widely utilized, which would enable more rigorous comparison across ecosystems and climates. The main objective of this research was to apply a standardized method for documenting carbon storage in vegetated coastal ecosystems along latitudinal gradients, including mangroves, tidal wetlands, and seagrass beds. Field sites were located in Twin Cays, Belize, three islands in Bocas del Toro, Panama, the Indian River Lagoon, Florida, Wachapreague, Virginia, three sites in San Francisco Bay, California, and three sites in Kachemak Bay, Alaska. At each mangrove and tidal wetland site, six deep soil cores were retrieved using an open faced gouge corer, ranging in depth from 70 to 496 cm and subsampled at set depth ranges. At each seagrass site, a one meter long piston corer was used to retrieve the core and subsampled using syringes. All samples were dried to a constant weight to determine dry bulk density. Samples were ground with a ball grinder and subsamples were burned in a muffle furnace to determine loss on ignition (LOI). For all seagrass samples, organic carbon was determined by differencing the percent carbon from ashed and unashed samples analyzed with an elemental analyzer. A subset of mangrove and tidal wetland samples were analyzed in an elemental analyzer to determine organic carbon and a relationship between LOI and percent carbon was determined and applied to the remaining samples. Total organic carbon was quantified with depth and summed for each core.
dataset.intellectualRights: This dataset is listed under a Creative Commons BY 4.0 and can be used with attribution. https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Methods identification code unique to each study.
Code indicating what type of device was used to collect soil depth profiles.

codeDefinition.definition: A half cylinder coring device in which the coring section is open, not sealed off by a fin
A device that extrudes core into tube upward with a plunger

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether live roots were included or excluded from carbon assessments.

codeDefinition.definition: Roots and rhizomes were included in dry bulk density and or organic matter and carbon measurements

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether or not sediment was sieved prior to carbon measurements.

codeDefinition.definition: Sediment was not sieved prior to analysis for organics.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating how the authors qualified or quantified compaction of the core.

codeDefinition.definition: Authors specified that the coring device's design minimized compaction

attribute.attributeDefinition: Temperature at which samples were dried to measure dry bulk density. This can include either samples that were freeze dried or oven dried.
Time over which samples were dried to measure dry bulk density.
Sample volume used for bulk density measurements, if held constant.
Any notable codes regarding how the authors quantified dry bulk density.

codeDefinition.definition: Bulk density time recorded herin is an approximate estimate

attribute.attributeDefinition: Temperature at which samples were combusted to estimate fraction organic matter.
Time over which samples were combusted to estimate fraction organic matter.
Whether or not carbonates were removed prior to calculating fraction organic carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Carbonates were removed before measuring organic carbon.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The method used to remove carbonates prior to measuring fraction carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Carbonates were removed using direct application of dilute acid
Samples were run twice in the elemental analyzer. Once with original sample and once with sample after LOI occurred, values were differenced to determine organic carbon

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether fraction_carbon refers to organic or total carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Author specified that fraction carbon measurements were of organic carbon

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any other submitter defined notes describing methodologies for determining dry bulk density, organic matter fraction, and carbon fraction.
Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Site identification code unique to each study.
Site description including relevant study details and political geographic units. Some of these descriptions can be automated by the ingestion code.

Code based on submitter field observation or measurement indicating average annual salinity (Note: Palustrine and freshwater should only include tidal wetlands, or wetlands that are potentially/formerly tidal but artificially freshened due to artificial tidal restrictions).
Indicate whether salinity_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement.

codeDefinition.definition: Salinity inferred by field observation such as vegetation
Salinity observed from local instrument.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any relevant submitter generated notes on how salinity_class was determined.
Code based on submitter field observations or measurement indicating dominant wetland vegetation type.

codeDefinition.definition: Describes wetlands dominated by persistent emergent vascular plants
Describes wetlands dominated by woody vegetation < or equal to 5 meters in height
Describes wetlands dominated by woody vegetation > 5 meters in height
Describes tidal or subtidal communities dominated by rooted vascular plants.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Indicate whether vegetation_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement.

codeDefinition.definition: Vegetation inferred by field observation
Vegetation measured by counts or plots.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any relevant submitter generated notes on how vegetation_class and/or dominant species were determined.
Code based on submitter field observation or measurement indicating how often the coring location is inundated.

codeDefinition.definition: Study-specific definition of an elevation relatively high in the tidal frame, typically defined by vegetation type
Study-specific definition of an elevation in the relative middle of the tidal frame, typically defined by vegetation type
Study-specific definition of an elevation in relatively low in the tidal frame, typically defined by vegetation type

attribute.attributeDefinition: Indicate whether inundation_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement.

codeDefinition.definition: Inundation inferred by field observation such as vegetation
Inundation class assessed from elevation and nearby tide gauge or other similar method.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any relevant submitter generated notes on how inundation was determined.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Core identification code unique to each site.
Year of core collection.
Numeric month of year of core collection.
Numeric day of month of core collection.
Any other relevant submitter generated notes on how cores were collected.
Positional latitude of the core in decimal degree WGS84.
Positional longitude of the core in decimal degree WGS84.
Accuracy of latitude and longitude measurement, if determined and recorded.
Code indicating how latitude and longitude were determined.

codeDefinition.definition: Conventional Commercially available hand-held GPS
Any other technique resulting in positional error > 30 meters.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any relevant submitter generated notes on how latitude and longitude were determined.
Indicated whether or not the coring team believes they recovered a full sediment profile, down to bedrock, or other non-marsh interface.

codeDefinition.code: core depth limited by length of corer
codeDefinition.definition: The total depth of the core was limited by the length of the coring device
Authors report that the depth of the core represents the depth of the wetland soil deposit

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Methods identification code unique to each study.
Site identification code unique to each study.
Core identification code unique to each site.
Minimum depth of a sampling increment.
Maximum depth of a sampling increment.
Dry mass per unit volume of a soil sample. This does not include ash free bulk density.
Mass of organic matter relative to sample dry mass. Ash free bulk density should not be used here but should be expressed as a loss on ignition fraction.
Mass of carbon relative to sample dry mass.
Any other submitter generated notes specific to the depth interval.
Code indicating the method for which fraction carbon was measured or modeled (Note: regression based models are permitted, but the use of the Bemmelen factor [0.58 gOC gOM-1] is discouraged).

codeDefinition.definition: Each sample presented was measured using Elemental Analysis
A regression model fit using a subset of measurements was used to predict fraction carbon as a function of fraction organic matter
Used regression model from Callaway et al., 2012, Estuaries and Coasts, to predict fraction carbon as a function of fraction organic matter

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Site identification code unique to each study.
Core identification code unique to each site.
Code associated with a species or a vegetation assemblage.
Defines whether the code refers to a description, or level of plant taxonomy.

codeDefinition.definition: Refers to a taxonomic genus without indicating a species.
Refers to taxonomic Genus and species.

unit.name: nominalMonth
unit.description: one month excluding leap seconds and leap days, 2628000 seconds
